ygData.subject: Re: Getting a GUILD up and going...
ygData.msgSnippet: I too agree with Sandy. We need unification! I am on Veeshan as 12th lvl Cleric, Layf (get bind in 2 more levels! Woohoo!) I know Beth is also on Veeshan.
ygData.messageBody:
I too agree with Sandy. We need unification!

I am on Veeshan as 12th lvl Cleric, Layf (get bind in 2 more levels! Woohoo!)

I know Beth is also on Veeshan. Wasn't there a same sex wedding on Veeshan? I
know there was on some server. I would want to continue to play on Veeshan some
of the time but could play half time on another server for the sake of the
guild. I have too many friends on Veeshan to give it up entirely though.

Perhaps the way to address this is also to find ways to contact other GLBT
people. We know there have to be plenty of queer and queer friendly (hello
Lora) people on all the servers to form guilds on all. How can we contact them?

I am thinking of ways. I know some gay mags like the Advocate have a cyber
section. I could send them a press release. Also, other mags too, like XY. But
I don't think I just want to go in game and start /shouting 'hey anybody want
to join a queer guild?' across all the zones.

This brings up another issue. What to name it. Some people are trying to make a
guild on the soon to be up race war server and call it the "Rainbow Warriors".
Personally, while I'm totally out in RL (anyone see my letter in the Advocate
with Xena on the cover?) I'm not wanting to be so bold in EQ which seems to be
populated with many sexually insecure teenage boys who would be all too happy
to start abusing us. I'd like the guild to be very subtle. So a name like "The
Stone Wall" or "Mattachine Society" or something else that would require a good
knowledge of gay history to understand would be better, IMO.

Also, I will be making a web page for GLBT EQ players. I will be posting the
info about my characters on it and will let you all know when I get it up. Then
if you like, you will be able to send me info about your characters to be put
on the page too.

Hugs,
David

scollier@... wrote:

> From: scollier@...
>
> I think getting a GUILD started is a GREAT idea...however...some of us are
> on different servers. We need unification..yes..I looked that word up just
> for this occasion! Lets start by saying what server we are all currently
> on, which character we play the MOST and go from there. The ONLY problem I
> see is that we may have to play our favorite character half time while we
> play our 'GUILD' character the other half. SHAME we cant transfer
> characters from server to server..sigh. Give me some feedbaack FOLKS! HUGS!
>
> Sandy
